I regretted this, the moment I played it. Much stronger is the silent tempo 31. h3! b5 (Nc8! threatens) 32. f5!, and h4, or c4...

What after 31. ... Nf6! I overlooked this strong reply. Most problems for black are solved, since 32. g5 Nh5 holds... After 31. ... f6? (what I hoped for), it is a different ballgame... Lesson? Never speculate...
